meanings.definition: Tending to deflect or cause deflection.
meanings.sent1: The shiny surface of the mirror was deflective, bouncing the light away.
meanings.sent2: The umbrella's deflective material kept the raindrops from hitting me.
meanings.sent3: The deflective behavior of the mischievous puppy made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her deflective response to criticism only made her seem more suspicious.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's deflective shield protected the city from harm.

meanings.definition: Capable of deflecting or turning aside.
meanings.sent1: The deflective armor of the knight saved him from the enemy's attack.
meanings.sent2: The deflective nature of the wall redirected the ball away from the window.
meanings.sent3: The deflective cat toy entertained the playful kitten for hours.
meanings.sent4: His deflective wit always managed to avoid answering difficult questions.
meanings.sent5: The deflective force field surrounded the spaceship, keeping it safe from asteroids.
